text: Heterogeneity of antigen molecules recognized by anti - <extra_id_0> tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> monoclonal antibody Lt-4 in cell lines bearing human T cell leukemia virus type I and related retroviruses .

Using a monoclonal antibody , Lt-4 , directed against human T cell leukemia virus type I ( HTLV-I ) trans - activator ( <extra_id_0> tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) antigen , we examined the expression of <extra_id_0> tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and related antigens in a variety of T cell lines bearing HTLV-I and related retroviruses , simian T cell leukemia virus type I ( STLV-I ) and HTLV-II , by immunofluorescence and immunoblot assays .
Lt-4 reacted with all HTLV-I-bearing cell lines tested and five out of eight simian cell lines bearing STLV-I , but not with an HTLV-II-bearing cell line .

Lt-4 detected 40 kd <extra_id_0> tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antigen molecules in most HTLV-I-bearing cell lines except one cell line that expressed 39 kd <extra_id_0> tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antigen .

In the STLV-I-bearing T cell lines , <extra_id_0> tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - related antigen molecules detected by Lt-4 were heterogeneous , having molecular weights in the range of 36-41 kd .
